comments:
I got the following exception in my log (running official 2.1 build with IBM 
SR2 JVM). I'm not sure exactly what I was doing at the time and I haven't 
witnessed any failures so I'm not sure why this is in the log. Either the error 
was recovered from (in which case I don't need to see a log entry) or there was 
a problem (in which case I should have seen an error dialog or some other 
warning).

org.eclipse.jdi.TimeoutException
at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.connect.PacketReceiveManager.getReply
(PacketReceiveManager.java(Compiled Code))
at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java(Compiled Code))
at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java(Compiled Code))
at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java(Compiled Code))
at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.MirrorImpl.requestVM(MirrorImpl.java(Compiled Code))
at org.eclipse.jdi.internal.ObjectReferenceImpl.isCollected
(ObjectReferenceImpl.java(Compiled Code))
at 
org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.model.JDIDebugTarget$ThreadStartHandler.hand
leEvent(JDIDebugTarget.java:1567)
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher.dispatch
(EventDispatcher.java(Compiled Code))
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.debug.core.EventDispatcher.run
(EventDispatcher.java:211)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:512)

Fixed. Removed the logging - we attempt to create the thread in the event of a 
timeout exception, so there is no need to log the failure. A failure will be 
logged in thread creation if it actually fails. (Change in 
JDIDebugTarget.ThreadStartHandler).
